questions.question_text: Which three methods are used by the collector agent for AD polling? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ABC
ABC
Fortigate 7.4 Administrator Study Guide page 130.

Selected Answer: ABC
Three methods: 
. NetAPI
. WinSecLog
. WMI

Selected Answer: ABC
A & B & C

A,B,C Three methods: 
. NetAPI
. WinSecLog
. WMI
I also looked up this question in other Fortigate versions and it says that is WinSecLog, WMI, NetAPI.

Selected Answer: ABC
The collector agent for Active Directory (AD) polling uses the following three methods:

A. WinSecLog: This method involves reading the Windows Security Event Log to gather information about user logins and logouts.

B. WMI (Windows Management Instrumentation): This method allows the collector agent to query the AD for user login information using WMI queries.

C. NetAPI: This method uses the Windows Network API to retrieve user login information from the AD.

These methods help the collector agent efficiently gather and monitor user activity within an AD environment.

Selected Answer: ABC
ABC is correct

questions.question_text: Which two statements about equal-cost multi-path (ECMP) configuration on FortiGate are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Page 90

Selected Answer: AD
Volume based is not able for ECMP
A and D correct

Selected Answer: AD
Took me some digging to find the source:
https://docs.fortinet.com/document/fortigate/7.4.6/administration-guide/25967/equal-cost-multi-path

Selected Answer: AD
A. If SD-WAN is enabled, you control the load balancing algorithm with the parameter load-balance-mode.
D. If SD-WAN is disabled, you configure the load balancing algorithm in config system settings.
A and D are correct
Correct is AD

Selected Answer: AD
Config system settings if SDWAN is disabled. 
Use load balance mode if SDWAN is enabled.

Selected Answer: AD
SD-WAN is enabled: v4-ecmp-mode is hide and you control the ECMP algorithm with the load-balance-mode setting.

SD-WAN is desabled ECMP algorithm is set on the CLI: config system settings.

Selected Answer: AD
Yip A and D it is.

Selected Answer: AD
It should be A and D

AD, "When SD-WAN is enabled, FortiOS hides the v4-ecmp-mode setting and replaces it with the loadbalance-mode setting under config system sdwan. That is, when you enable SD-WAN, you control the ECMP algorithm with the load-balance-mode setting." 

The statement C. If SD-WAN is enabled, you can configure routes with unequal distance and priority values to be part of ECMP is incorrect because ECMP requires routes to have equal cost, which means that the routes must have the same distance and priority values to be considered for load balancing.

In contrast, ECMP specifically balances traffic across multiple paths that have equal cost, hence the term "equal-cost" in ECMP. If the distance or priority values are different, those routes would not be eligible for ECMP.

Therefore, A and D are correct, and C is incorrect.

comments.content: I was wrong. A and D are correct.

discussion.content:
A and C are correct.

B is incorrect. While when SDWAN is disabled, you have the v4-ecmp-mode available. However, "volume-based" is a load-balance-mode setting and is not available.
D is incorrect because if you disable SDWAN, you turn off the load balancing algorithm.

choices.D: If SD-WAN is disabled, you configure the load balancing algorithm in config system settings.
choices.A: If SD-WAN is enabled, you control the load balancing algorithm with the parameter load-balance-mode.
choices.C: If SD-WAN is enabled, you can configure routes with unequal distance and priority values to be part of ECMP
choices.B: If SD-WAN is disabled, you can configure the parameter v4-ecmp-mode to volume-based.

questions.question_text: What are two features of collector agent advanced mode? (Choose two.)

choices.A: In advanced mode, FortiGate can be configured as an LDAP client and group filters can be configured on FortiGate.
choices.B: Advanced mode supports nested or inherited groups.
choices.C: In advanced mode, security profiles can be applied only to user groups, not individual users.
choices.D: Advanced mode uses the Windows convention —NetBios: Domain\Username.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
Refer the FCP FGT Administrator 7.4 Study Guide
Page No: 146
Chapter: FSSO

Selected Answer: AB
A & B
A&D are correct.

Selected Answer: AB
AB.
AB
AB. page 137

Selected Answer: C
Uses protected DNS traffic, DNS over TLS

Selected Answer: C
C. It uses DNS over TLS.

By default, uses DNS over TLS DoT to secure DNS traffic
c is correct
C, Page 24

Selected Answer: C
C - 
pg 24 of study guide. 
Lesson 1, Slide 21 of training deck

When using FortiGuard servers for DNS, FortiOS uses DNS over TLS (DoT) by default to secure the DNS traffic. New FortiGuard DNS servers have been added as primary and secondary servers.

Correct Answer: C. It uses DNS over TLS.

Reference: FCP - FortiGate 7.4 Administrator Self-Paced Guide, page 24.

questions.question_text:
An administrator configures FortiGuard servers as DNS servers on FortiGate using default settings.
What is true about the DNS connection to a FortiGuard server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct
In Flow Based scanning, if a virus is detected, the final packet is dropped making the file unusable tot the end user. FG caches the URL of the file. If the user attempts to download again, rather than scanning the file again, the IPS engine then sends a block message to the user.

Selected Answer: D
D. Flow-based inspection is used, which resets the last packet to the user

Selected Answer: D
D. Flow-based inspection is used, which resets the last packet to the user.
¿D? are correct

Selected Answer: D
Page 200

Correct Answer: D. Flow-based inspection is used, which resets the last packet to the user.

Reference: FCP - FortiGate 7.4 Administrator Self-Paced Guide, page 200.

choices.D: Flow-based inspection is used, which resets the last packet to the user.
choices.C: The firewall policy performs a full content inspection on the file.
choices.B: The option to send files to FortiSandbox for inspection is enabled.
choices.A: The intrusion prevention security profile must be enabled when using flow-based inspection mode.
